com.intuit.wasabi.tests.library

Class APIServerConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intuit.wasabi.tests.library.APIServerConnector

  • public class APIServerConnector
extends Object
    An APIServerConnector object stores the current server url, and provides methods for doing REST GET, POST, etc. to the server.
    Since:
    September 5, 2014 If a non-null user name is passed to the constructor, then basic, preemptive authentication will be used. The clone method is meant for making a clone of a connector that then can be modified using the setters, thus avoiding to have to specify all arguments that otherwise go into a constructor call.

        public APIServerConnector(String baseUri,
                          String basePath,
                          String userName,
                          String password,
                          Map<String,String> headerMap)
        Instantiates an APIServerConnector object.
        Parameters:
        baseUri - The server uri including http or https and possibly with :portnumber
        basePath - the base path
        userName - the user name
        password - the password
        headerMap - the headers

        public com.jayway.restassured.response.Response doPost(String url,
                                                       Object jsonBody)
        Does a HTTP POST with the given formJSON in the body
        Parameters:
        url - The API call part of the URL (i.e. everything after ".../api/v1/").
        jsonBody - The JSON body to pass to the REST API call. Can be either a String, or an Object which can convert to a JSON string using Gson's toJson method.
        Returns:
        The response object returned
